item.title: Vaccination
item.description: Principle You inject antigens into the body. Then antibodies are generated, which last for a certain duration. Booster doses might increase the duration. Efficacy Vaccine efficacy - % reduction in disease incidence in a vaccinated group compared to an unvaccinated group under optimal conditions Vaccine effectiveness - ability of vaccine to prevent outcomes of interest in the “real world” For some vaccines, booster dose increases efficacy. vaccine efficacy Policy Factors Cost of disease vs cost of vaccination (including adverse effects)
